page.title: 15Thomas Delarue School.
page.content: Thomas Delarue is a school for spastics.It was built in 1963 and opened by H.R.H. Prince Philip in 1964.The school helps the students (11-19)reach O level and A level standard. The students are spastics because their bodies are deformed and they are unable to control their movements.Some are unable to hear.All the students are residential sharing their cheerful dormitories with other students. To help them communicate there are computers with finger grids on to enable them to press the right key.Wheelchairs are used for moving around, some are electric and the rest are powered by hand.To help them relax they have a swimming pool which has to be permanently heated to help the students' muscles.The school has its own nature trail. Tanya
